content.title: Pancreas Transplant Vascular Techniques
content.definition: Vascular anastomotic techniques for whole pancreas transplantation, including arterial Y-graft reconstruction and venous drainage options.

key_concepts.description: Pancreas has dual arterial supply: superior mesenteric artery (head) and splenic artery (body/tail). Requires reconstruction for single inflow.
Donor iliac artery bifurcation used to create Y-graft anastomosed to SMA and splenic artery for single arterial inflow.
Systemic (iliac vein) vs portal (SMV). Portal drainage more physiologic but technically demanding.

arterial.y_graft: Donor common iliac to EIA/IIA, anastomosed to SMA and splenic artery
arterial.technique: End-to-end anastomosis of EIA to SMA, IIA to splenic artery
arterial.alternative: Single vessel anastomosis if SMA dominant with large GDA

venous.preparation: Ensure adequate length of portal vein
venous.extension: Donor iliac vein if needed for length

arterial.standard: Y-graft to recipient right common or external iliac artery

venous_systemic.target: Right common or external iliac vein

venous_portal.disadvantages: More technically demanding, pancreas positioned differently

spk.name: Simultaneous Pancreas-Kidney
spk.positioning: Kidney left iliac fossa, pancreas right

pta.name: Pancreas Transplant Alone
pta.indication: Type 1 diabetes with preserved kidney function

thrombosis.consequences: Graft loss if not detected early

complications.arterial_stenosis: Late complication - may present with hyperglycemia

content.statement: Pancreas Transplant Vascular Techniques is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Transplant-Vascular that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Pancreas Transplant Vascular Techniques helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Pancreas Transplant Vascular Techniques include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Pancreas Transplant Vascular Techniques.

learning_objectives: Describe Y-graft reconstruction for pancreas transplant arterial inflow
Compare systemic vs portal venous drainage options
Explain the different transplant configurations (SPK, PTA, PAK)
Discuss vascular complications and their management
clinical_pearls: Y-graft from donor iliac vessels is standard for arterial reconstruction
Portal drainage is more physiologic but technically demanding
Thrombosis is the leading cause of early graft loss
Confirm flow with Doppler before closing
